title: Naberius
data:
**Naberius, mysterious councilor** is a [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Ritual, seal and taboo](#Ritual.2C_seal_and_taboo)

- [2 Mark](#Mark)

- [3 Benefits](#Benefits)

- [4 As a monster](#As_a_monster)

  - [4.1 Generation](#Generation)
  - [4.2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Ritual, seal and taboo

Naberius must be addressed by a character with at least 14 [Int](/wiki/Int "Int") and [Wis](/wiki/Wis "Wis") while they are confused or have drunk at least one [potion of booze](/wiki/Potion_of_booze "Potion of booze") per [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level").

To keep Naberius bound, the character must have drunk at least one potion of booze per three experience levels over the course of the game (e.g. a level 9 character must have drunk at least three potions of booze). [Drunkenness](/wiki/Drunkenness "Drunkenness") is normally capped at 3 potions of booze per level, and further potions will not be counted.

## Mark

A character that has Naberius bound develops a forked tongue. The tongue can only be seen up close, and wearing a [mask](/wiki/Mask_\(dNetHack\) "Mask (dNetHack)") can hide the character's mouth.

## Benefits

Naberius confers [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible"), and grants skill in [attack spells](/wiki/Attack_spell "Attack spell") and [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff").

Naberius's active powers are as follows:

- **Bloody Tongue**: Causes chosen single adjacent monster to flee. Does not count as a hostile act.
- **Silver Tongue**: Attempts to tame chosen single adjacent monster. Note that the cap of 1 pet per 3 points of Cha applies. Excess pets will quickly untame.

Naberius's passive powers are as follows:

- **Crimson Fangs**: Adds an extra 1d6 bite to your attacks. This attack heals you by d8 HP when you use it on a fleeing target or stun and confuse a peaceful target.
- **Rhetoric of Magic**: Spellcasting is enhanced - spell explosions cover a 5x5 square, rays from spells are twice in length, and spells do +50% more damage, which stacks with other effects that grant double spell damage (e.g. [the Magic Mirror of Merlin](/wiki/The_Magic_Mirror_of_Merlin "The Magic Mirror of Merlin")).
- **Arts and Sciences**: All skills are treated as at least Basic for relevant checks, including lightsaber forms, even if restricted.

## As a monster

| d Naberius *(No tile)*                                          |                                                                                                                  |
| --------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **[Difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty")** | 40                                                                                                               |
| **Attacks**                                                     | bite 6d6 physical, bite 4d6 physical, bite 6d6 physical, bite 4d6 physical, bite 6d6 physical, bite 4d6 physical |
|                                                                 |                                                                                                                  |

| d Naberius *(No tile)*                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                  |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **[Difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | 40                                                                                                               |

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                  |

| **Base [experience](/wiki/Experience_points "Experience points")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | 1928                                                                                                             |
| **[Speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | 20                                                                                                               |

| **[Alignment](/wiki/Alignment#Monster_alignment "Alignment")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | -1 (chaotic)                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                  |
| **[Frequency](/wiki/Monster_frequency "Monster frequency")** (by [normal means](/wiki/Normal_mechanism "Normal mechanism"))                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | 0 (Not randomly generated)                                                                                       |
| **[Genocidable](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | No                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                  |
| **[Weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     | 3000                                                                                                             |
| **[Nutritional value](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | 800                                                                                                              |
| **[Size](/wiki/Physical_size "Physical size")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | huge                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                  |
| **[Resistances](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire")                                                                                        |
| **Resistances [conveyed](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire")                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                  |
| Naberius:* has no hands.
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is male.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* may [turn against you](/wiki/Treachery "Treachery") when tame. |                                                                                                                  |

In notdNetHack, **Naberius**, d, also appears as a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that can be summoned by an [Illithanachronounbinder](/wiki/Illithanachronounbinder "Illithanachronounbinder"). He is a [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") [canine](/wiki/Canine "Canine")-like [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal") that can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").

Naberius has six bite attacks that alternate between 6d6 and 4d6 damage dice, and possesses [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance").

Naberius may turn [traitor](/wiki/Traitor "Traitor") while tame.

### Generation

Naberius is first generated when summoned from his seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for normal [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

Naberius is [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") 9 to 11 potions of booze.

Naberius [does not leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death.

### Strategy

**Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role.** They can be accessed by selecting the "Role spoiler" tab.

[x][ ]

- Strategy
- Role spoiler

Naberius possesses a solid 15 points of natural [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") (effectively -5), and his several strong bite attacks and 20 [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") allow him to deal fearsome melee damage - despite this, he is likely to be much less dangerous than this implies: an Illithanachronounbinder facing Naberius is likely to have a high [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") that reduces the damage of each bite, and will already have at least one source of very fast speed and a method to create distance between them (e.g. [Eurynome's Dancing Shoes](/index.php?title=Eurynome%27s_Dancing_Shoes\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Eurynome's Dancing Shoes (page does not exist)"), the psionic pulse ability gained at [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 4). Illithanachronounbinders will also likely have knowledge of some applicable [wards](/wiki/Ward_\(dNetHack\) "Ward (dNetHack)") that can keep Naberius further out of melee range and at their mercy.

If Naberius is killed after being summoned, he can be encountered again in the [Void](/index.php?title=Void\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Void (page does not exist)"), a branch accessed by opening the high [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") of [Ilsensine the Fallen](/wiki/Ilsensine_the_Fallen "Ilsensine the Fallen") as an Illithanachronounbinder using the [invoke](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") effect of [The Elder Cerebral Fluid](/wiki/The_Elder_Cerebral_Fluid "The Elder Cerebral Fluid"). Naberius is placed randomly along with many other spirits of the near void on the second floor of the branch, and is generated with the "whispers" template, which makes him [nonliving](/wiki/Nonliving "Nonliving").

## Encyclopedia entry

The Twenty-fourth Spirit is Naberius. He is a most valiant Marquis, and showeth in the form of a Black Crane, fluttering about the Circle, and when he speaketh it is with a hoarse voice. He maketh men cunning in all Arts and Sciences, but especially in the Art of Rhetoric. He restoreth lost Dignities and Honours. He governeth 19 Legions of Spirits. His Seal is this, which is to be worn, etc.  
  
\[ The Lesser Key of Solomon ]

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Naberius

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Naberius, mysterious councilor is a spirit that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Ritual, seal and taboo
  • 2 Mark
  • 3 Benefits
  • 4 As a monster
    • 4.1 Generation
    • 4.2 Strategy
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry

Ritual, seal and taboo

Naberius must be addressed by a character with at least 14 Int and Wis while they are confused or have drunk at least one potion of booze per experience level.

To keep Naberius bound, the character must have drunk at least one potion of booze per three experience levels over the course of the game (e.g. a level 9 character must have drunk at least three potions of booze). Drunkenness is normally capped at 3 potions of booze per level, and further potions will not be counted.

Mark

A character that has Naberius bound develops a forked tongue. The tongue can only be seen up close, and wearing a mask can hide the character's mouth.

Benefits

Naberius confers see invisible, and grants skill in attack spells and quarterstaff.

Naberius's active powers are as follows:

  • Bloody Tongue: Causes chosen single adjacent monster to flee. Does not count as a hostile act.
  • Silver Tongue: Attempts to tame chosen single adjacent monster. Note that the cap of 1 pet per 3 points of Cha applies. Excess pets will quickly untame.

Naberius's passive powers are as follows:

  • Crimson Fangs: Adds an extra 1d6 bite to your attacks. This attack heals you by d8 HP when you use it on a fleeing target or stun and confuse a peaceful target.
  • Rhetoric of Magic: Spellcasting is enhanced - spell explosions cover a 5x5 square, rays from spells are twice in length, and spells do +50% more damage, which stacks with other effects that grant double spell damage (e.g. the Magic Mirror of Merlin).
  • Arts and Sciences: All skills are treated as at least Basic for relevant checks, including lightsaber forms, even if restricted.

As a monster

d Naberius (No tile)
Difficulty 40
Attacks bite 6d6 physical, bite 4d6 physical, bite 6d6 physical, bite 4d6 physical, bite 6d6 physical, bite 4d6 physical
d Naberius (No tile)
Difficulty 40
Attacks

bite 6d6 physical, bite 4d6 physical, bite 6d6 physical, bite 4d6 physical, bite 6d6 physical, bite 4d6 physical

Base level 33
Base experience 1928
Speed 20
Base AC -5
Base MR 20
Alignment -1 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 3000
Nutritional value 800
Size huge
Resistances fire
Resistances conveyed fire

Naberius:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is male.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is nasty.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • may turn against you when tame.

In notdNetHack, Naberius, d, also appears as a monster that can be summoned by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is a carnivorous canine-like animal that can be seen via infravision.

Naberius has six bite attacks that alternate between 6d6 and 4d6 damage dice, and possesses fire resistance.

Naberius may turn traitor while tame.

Generation

Naberius is first generated when summoned from his seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for normal polymorph.

Naberius is generated with 9 to 11 potions of booze.

Naberius does not leave a corpse upon death.

Strategy

Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role. They can be accessed by selecting the "Role spoiler" tab.

Naberius possesses a solid 15 points of natural AC (effectively -5), and his several strong bite attacks and 20 speed allow him to deal fearsome melee damage - despite this, he is likely to be much less dangerous than this implies: an Illithanachronounbinder facing Naberius is likely to have a high DR that reduces the damage of each bite, and will already have at least one source of very fast speed and a method to create distance between them (e.g. Eurynome's Dancing Shoes, the psionic pulse ability gained at experience level 4). Illithanachronounbinders will also likely have knowledge of some applicable wards that can keep Naberius further out of melee range and at their mercy.

If Naberius is killed after being summoned, he can be encountered again in the Void, a branch accessed by opening the high altar of Ilsensine the Fallen as an Illithanachronounbinder using the invoke effect of The Elder Cerebral Fluid. Naberius is placed randomly along with many other spirits of the near void on the second floor of the branch, and is generated with the "whispers" template, which makes him nonliving.

Encyclopedia entry

The Twenty-fourth Spirit is Naberius. He is a most valiant Marquis, and showeth in the form of a Black Crane, fluttering about the Circle, and when he speaketh it is with a hoarse voice. He maketh men cunning in all Arts and Sciences, but especially in the Art of Rhetoric. He restoreth lost Dignities and Honours. He governeth 19 Legions of Spirits. His Seal is this, which is to be worn, etc.

[ The Lesser Key of Solomon ]

Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Naberius&oldid=168064"

'''Naberius, mysterious councilor''' is a [[Spirits (dNetHack)|spirit]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]].

==Ritual, seal and taboo==
Naberius must be addressed by a character with at least 14 [[Int]] and [[Wis]] while they are confused or have drunk at least one [[potion of booze]] per [[experience level]].

To keep Naberius bound, the character must have drunk at least one potion of booze per three experience levels over the course of the game (e.g. a level 9 character must have drunk at least three potions of booze). [[Drunkenness]] is normally capped at 3 potions of booze per level, and further potions will not be counted.

==Mark==
A character that has Naberius bound develops a forked tongue. The tongue can only be seen up close, and wearing a [[Mask (dNetHack)|mask]] can hide the character's mouth.

==Benefits==
Naberius confers [[see invisible]], and grants skill in [[attack spell]]s and [[quarterstaff]].

Naberius's active powers are as follows:

* '''Bloody Tongue''': Causes chosen single adjacent monster to flee. Does not count as a hostile act.
* '''Silver Tongue''': Attempts to tame chosen single adjacent monster.  Note that the cap of 1 pet per 3 points of Cha applies.  Excess pets will quickly untame.

Naberius's passive powers are as follows:

* '''Crimson Fangs''': Adds an extra 1d6 bite to your attacks. This attack heals you by d8 HP when you use it on a fleeing target or stun and confuse a peaceful target.
* '''Rhetoric of Magic''': Spellcasting is enhanced - spell explosions cover a 5x5 square, rays from spells are twice in length, and spells do +50% more damage, which stacks with other effects that grant double spell damage (e.g. [[the Magic Mirror of Merlin]]).
* '''Arts and Sciences''': All skills are treated as at least Basic for relevant checks, including lightsaber forms, even if restricted.

In notdNetHack, '''Naberius''', {{magenta|d}}, also appears as a [[monster]] that can be summoned by an [[Illithanachronounbinder]]. He is a [[carnivorous]] [[canine]]-like [[animal]] that can be seen via [[infravision]].

Naberius has six bite attacks that alternate between 6d6 and 4d6 damage dice, and possesses [[fire resistance]].

Naberius may turn [[traitor]] while tame.

===Generation===
Naberius is first generated when summoned from his seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. He is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for normal [[polymorph]].

Naberius is [[Monster starting inventory|generated with]] 9 to 11 potions of booze.

Naberius [[Corpseless|does not leave a corpse]] upon death.

Illithanachronounbinders will also likely have knowledge of some applicable [[Ward (dNetHack)|wards]] that can keep Naberius further out of melee range and at their mercy.
